cw4

Class Ocean

  • java.lang.Object
    • cw4.Ocean

  • public class Ocean
extends java.lang.Object
    The game board

    A 10 x 10 array of ships, representing the ocean

    Author:
    pete

      • setShip

        public void setShip(int row,
                    int column,
                    Ship ship)
        Place a ship on the board
        Parameters:
        row - Row number location for bow of ship
        column - Column number location for bow of ship
        ship - Ship type to place

      • placeAllShipsRandomly

        public void placeAllShipsRandomly()
        Places all ships randomly on the game board

        Creates a fleet 'stack' and passes this to the recurse placeShip method

      • placeShip

        private void placeShip(java.util.Stack<Ship> fleet)
        Place ships until no ships left to place

        Recursive method that uses backtracking to ensure all ships are placed on the game board in valid locations

        Parameters:
        fleet - Stack of ships to be place

      • getEmptyTiles

        public java.util.List<java.awt.Point> getEmptyTiles()
        Return the co-ordinates empty tiles (EmptySea objects) on the board

        Helper method used in placing the ships

        Returns:
        List of empty sea co-ordinates

      • isOccupied

        public boolean isOccupied(int row,
                          int column)
        Check if a co-ordinate has a ship in that location
        Parameters:
        row - Row number to check
        column - Column number to check
        Returns:
        True if a ship exists at that location, false if it is empty sea

      • isOnBoard

        public boolean isOnBoard(int row,
                         int column)
        Check if co-ordinate is a valid game tile (on the gameboard)
        Parameters:
        row - Row number to check
        column - Column number to check
        Returns:
        True if co-ordinate is a tile on the gameboard, otherwise false

      • shootAt

        public boolean shootAt(int row,
                       int column)
        Shoot at the ship at the give co-ordinates
        Parameters:
        row - Row number to shoot at
        column - Column number to shoot at
        Returns:
        True if shot is a hit, false if it is a miss

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Check if game is over

        Compares number of ships to the fleet size

        Returns:
        True if all ships sunk, false if there are still ships afloat

      • print

        public void print()
        Print the game board to the console
